items.location: Downtown Disney

place_details.adr_address: 1486 Buena Vista Dr, Orlando, FL 32830, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 1486 Buena Vista Dr, Orlando, FL 32830, United States
place_details.name: Disney Springs

reviews.text: Dowtown Disney is a shopping district.  I went to the Rainforest Cafe.   Like the simulated thunder/lightning, fish, and gorillas.  Service was excellent.  I got the Paella and it was horrible.  The rice was mushy, barely any seafood, and the chicken tasted reheated (I hate the taste of reheated meat.)  The picture had calamari in it, I didn't see any.  Nothing like the Paella I had at a real Spanish (Spain not Mexican) restaurant in Chicago.  For $40 including tax and tip, I was very disappointed. The rest of my family enjoyed their food.  I just picked the wrong thing to eat.

A construction filled nightmare. Been going here over twenty years and have always appreciated expansion. Disney is known for doing things well. Now the whole area is being leased to outside retailers and the Disney themed stores are being changed. Where is the Disney in Disney Springs? Elevator music playing throughout, inventory reductions at the last remaining Disney stores.... If I wanted to go to City Walk, I'd stay at Universal. All that's missing is the moving sidewalk from the massive parking structures.

Most people think that downtown Disney is a place that you have to go to shop, it is an option but that isn't the only thing to do there in order to enjoy yourself. There are performances from very talented people, everyone there is always happy! Great environment!

The heavy construction and traffic is a nightmare to try and get to this location. I live in Orlando so know the area quite well. One garage is open on the West Side but there still can be a back up and traffic getting in and out. The East Side has No Parking except behind the Hess gas station which is 1/2 mile from the entrance. Also, you need to cross a very busy street that has a cross walk and light that can take up to 5 minutes or more to activate. If you do not mind walking a mile or more and waiting to get across a busy road, then Down Town Disney East Side is the place to go. I will wait for all the construction to finish next year before going back to see if anything has improved. If you are on vacation and really need to go someplace to shop, I would try the Premium Outlet and Mall both off I-4 with plenty of parking and even a Disney Outlet store with great discounts. I am heading there tomorrow to pick up a few Christmas items that are 50 percent off.

The blues bar staff were great and helpful after a poor advice from the front reception allowing us to sit at the bar which if you need a drink or food and stay at the bar is illegal for any under 21.Although busy the bar staff found us a great table tucked away after ordering and still ensured we were OK. Proper customer care.just show your appreciation tip well and keep these people working

place_details.formatted_address: 1830 Kellogg Dr, Anaheim, CA 92807, United States

reviews.text: I attended this school and it was great.  Great experiences, teachers and now my children attend there.  The teachers are young and energetic.  It's like a changing of the guard at this school and we are proud to have our daughter there!
It is a great school.
no
Football
Just because

items.location: Blue Whale Los Angeles

place_details.adr_address: 123 Astronaut E S Onizuka St #301, Los Angeles, CA 90012, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 123 Astronaut E S Onizuka St #301, Los Angeles, CA 90012, United States
place_details.name: Blue Whale

reviews.text:
Went to the club for the first time last night.
Arrived 10 minutes early and was me by a rude doorman who told me the club would not open until 8 o'clock. Came back at 8, a sign was posted "opening soon". Meanwhile some 'wanna be chorus dancers were practicing on stage. They were horrible.
Unfortunately, I did not come back nor listen to any jazz at this club. I do not think I will come back.

Please update. They ARE OPEN ON SUNDAYS 7:39-1am.
Fabulous experience EVERY TIME I  go.
The best place for Jazz and Beer.

Excellent and intimate jazz venue. On a recent visit to LA, we went to see Josh Nelson at the Blue Whale. The venue was a perfect setting for the jazz trio. We found all seats to provide an excellent view of the performance. We enjoyed the interesting art installation.
Excellent jazz benue

place_details.vicinity: 123 Astronaut E S Onizuka Street #301, Los Angeles

items.location: Spaghettini's

place_details.adr_address: 3005 Old Ranch Pkwy, Seal Beach, CA 90740, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 3005 Old Ranch Pkwy, Seal Beach, CA 90740, United States
place_details.name: Spaghettini

reviews.text: Great music and good food

Love the live music here!

The service is really good, we have been here a couple of times in the past few years and the experience has been pretty good. We love their happy hour specials in the lounge area. Discount drinks and appetizers. The food is great and they have different bands that perform here all the time. Very romantic spot.
I enjoyed enjoy the company:) :) :)

Hosted my wedding reception there this past weekend. Spent thousands of dollars, and ended the evening very disappointed. The wait staff were not attentive to detail. The main entrée was served semi warm. I was expecting a hot meal, not warm. Crème brulee came with the meal and its portion size was so ridiculous. Its more of a sample size. the top layer wasn't caramelized. It tasted like vanilla pudding with only 3 bites in the tiny cup.  Even worse, my guests had to serve themselves for cake/dessert and had to ask if there was coffee/tea available. For the price I paid, I expected a much better dining experience. The staff was too focused on making sure certain guests kept ordering alcoholic beverages, but the drinks that came with the meals (coffee, tea, soft drinks) was not offered/served. If you are planning a dinner party, go somewhere else. This place is not worth the money .
The ambiance is always stellar!

items.location: The Lighthouse Hermosa Beach

place_details.adr_address: 30 Pier Ave, Hermosa Beach, CA 90254, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 30 Pier Ave, Hermosa Beach, CA 90254, United States
place_details.name: Lighthouse Café

reviews.text: good food drinks and people I really like the live jazz Saturdays its peaceful
Good venue for entertainment. Disappointed with the bartending... VERY inexperienced. Management needs ro hire experienced ones or train what they have.

My husband and I have been looking for a live Reggae spot to go to from time to time. We didn't want anything to fancy or the early twenties crowd. We stumbled across the Lighthouse and had such a wonderful time last night, we stayed for all three sets. The band was Jahmark and the Soulshakers. We ate dinner, danced had a few drinks. We will be regulars. Come join us.

We went in around 2pm on Sunday and listen to some very good Jazz Music the band was wonderful, (Janis Mann Quartet)
We stood and listen to Urban Dread and they were also very good as well.

I will definatly be coming back! 

Thank you 

Gilbert Perez.
they have the greatest Reggae music on Sundays.... Everyone have a good time...

items.location:
Silvana
300 W 116th St
New York NY 10026

place_details.adr_address: 300 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 300 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, United States
place_details.name: Silvana

reviews.text: Olok o)l p.o. olo ll ol
Fresh and affordable. Loved the hummus, falafel and bubbaganoush. Great for the area.

A nice place to go for some live music and specialty cocktails. 

Bags will be checked at the door and outside food & drinks are not allowed inside, so you will have to leave them outside with the bouncer.

There may or may not be a cover when you go, and the doorman may or may not make you pay it (if he is friendly).

Great live music. Falafel plate excellent: the diverse sauces and elements come in tiny stylish squarish bowls filled to the brim: these could be bigger as its hard to get the salad out without it spilling everywhere. Nice people, nice vibe.

I was really turned off my not being able to get into the downstairs party unless I checked my hat into a cardboard box sitting on the ground. The doorman (who wore a hat) said no hats are allowed inside. When I offered to place my hat in my satchel they said "No". This made me not even wanna go inside to meet my friends who were waiting for me. This place is scratched off the list for me as far harlem night spots. Mind you this was a tuesday night, and OK i had to be patted down and searched for everyones safety, but the hat must be placed in cardboard box on ground policy is absolutely ridiculous, and pretty insulting. I wonder if lighter skin patrons have the same difficulties.

items.location:
Richard Nixon Library and Birthplace
18001 Yorba Linda Blvd
Yorba Linda CA 92886

place_details.adr_address: 18001 Yorba Linda Blvd, Yorba Linda, CA 92886, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 18001 Yorba Linda Blvd, Yorba Linda, CA 92886, United States
place_details.name: The Richard Nixon Library & Museum

reviews.text: Great library to a misunderstood president, though Watergate happened, he is shadowed by it, and people don't realize the good he did for America, Socially and economically, not to mention great foreign affairs with China! Still not as good as the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library.

An interesting visit. . .but be prepared.    The Nixon administration (RMN) , while causing irreparable damage to the Presidency and our election process (Watergate) did some remarkable good in the fields of social & environmental welfare, let alone the far sightedness to begin talks with China.   

 RMN began the negative income tax to support the working poor,  he established both OSHA (Occupational, Safety & Health Admin),   the EPA (Environmental Protection Agency) and the Endangered Species Act.       Sadly, the Nixon Library remains transfixed on reforming RMN (a Republican that was more rooted in the needs of the individual without rewarding the excesses of corporate interests and equally concerned about trying negotiation before bombs - China policy)  as a modern Reagan style Republican (who are deeply interested in tearing down environmental policies and Governmental policies promoting the greater good and promoting large corporate interests and producing 'pre-emptive wars to prevent wars).

More time would be better spent by the Library staff in giving equal exposure to all sides of this very complex man.   But, by doing so, by presenting RMN's social concerns and actions, RMN would likely come across as a 'liberal'  by the standards post Reagan and GW Bush.   

So, history takes a back seat at this Library to the needs of politics.   A pity and a shame.

My wife and I visited the library/museum today and we felt that it was a great library/museum.  There was just one problem, the air-conditioning temperature was set so cold that we were thoroughly chilled by the time we left the facility.  I am not sure exactly why they had it set to be so cold but it was almost unbearable.  We have been in many other temperature controlled museums and they did not have the temperature set to be so cold...Please warm it up a few degrees so us folks from the desert of Arizona can enjoy it more and not have to shiver all the way through the museum.  It was a very education facility and very well done.  A couple of things we did notice was the putting of green print on a green background made it difficult to read.  Also, having print directly under glass was also very difficult to read.  All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  After all, we spent nearly four and a half hours perusing all of the material that was on display.  On the down side though, it was unfortunate that the helicopter was not open for viewing today as they were short one docent and did not have enough staff to handle opening of the helicopter.  Very disappointing.  Overall a very good museum.

I have lived by this museum for years. Never thought about going until I was driving by today and spotted a helicopter. Went in and was blown away! Beautiful museum and staff is awesome!  I am now a fan of Richard and Pat Nixon. Wonderful experience. Can't wait to go back.
Wonderful, but everybody in my class ended up with a headache in the end.

items.location:
Marconi Automotive Museum
1302 Industrial Dr
Tustin CA 92780

place_details.adr_address: 1302 Industrial Dr, Tustin, CA 92780-6416, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 1302 Industrial Dr, Tustin, CA 92780, United States
place_details.name: Marconi Automotive Museum

reviews.text:
This place is the absolute definition of a "hidden gem".  

Love original GT500 Mustangs?  They got it.  The last production Lamborghini Countach?  It's there.  Unique Ferrari's?  Yep.   

Go.  Enjoy.

it was awesome, we stopped by because we had picked up my father in law from John Wayne airport. my wife was looking for a nearby museum and found this one. I walked up to the clerk register, the lady was super nice and treated me with respect. She makes you feel welcome and explains everything you need to know to get started. The set up is nice its a self tour and boy did we love it. There are cars for all ages, we all had so much fun. The donation price is perfect.
I recently had a retirement party here and this place is great!  Desiree is the event coordinator and she ROCKS!  Great help, handles everything and very professional.

items.location: Nixon

place_details.adr_address: 701 S Coast Hwy 101, Encinitas, CA 92024-4441, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 701 S Coast Hwy 101, Encinitas, CA 92024, United States
place_details.name: Nixon

reviews.text: Bought a beautiful Nixon watch from Tillys for my husband for Fathers day.  He opened and loved it.  Could'nt set the day or time.  I Tried to take back to Tillys for exchange, no  I have to contact Nixon repair.  Okay I  sent the watch in for repair back on June 26, fedex next day, I have followed up every week and still no return of watch.  6 weeks and nothing!  Love the brand and the style, but you just lost a customer!!

I dropped my watch off to have the band replaced and waited patiently.  I was one day away from calling to check the status of my watch as it was well beyond the 10 working day window; lo and behold when I woke up this morning there was an email in my inbox; the watch was on it's way.  It was late but only by a few days, and it is the holiday season so it is completely understandable.  To my surprise it arrived the day same day and instead of replacing the band they figured I needed a new watch at no extra charge.  I am one who would rather wait and receive better service than to have the issue rushed through.  Thank you for the new watch!

More than Happy with the service i recieved from this place. I dropped my watch off to have my band repaired. They took the watch and my information and said it wouldnt be a problem to fix.  I recieved a watch with a brand new band in the mail 10 days later. THANK YOU NIXON!
Bought these hats. Huge selection from there website. Go NIXON!

items.location:
The Escondite
410 Boyd St
Los Angeles CA 90013

place_details.adr_address: 410 Boyd St, Los Angeles, CA 90013-1631, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 410 Boyd St, Los Angeles, CA 90013, United States
place_details.name: The Escondite

reviews.text: My mom and I , and dad , love my miller high life beer and getting our grilled cheese sandwiches,  which are out of this world .!! The fresh potato  french fries ....YUM !! Not only yhe food , but the atmosphere is great ! The girls that work/bartend there are the Best ! Always remembers you and are so welcoming.  Thank you for being the high point  of our 2-3 hour trips to L.A. . See ya next month .😚
A perfect escape from the toy district that I got myself trap into :-). I was there during day time; great service, delicious burgers and great choice of beer. Everything was excellent!
If you wana see douchebaggery fest, lots of leather wrist bands, wanabe Hollywood losers from other states...this is the place to be.
Best burgers in LA and a great beer selection!

Escondite is known for their live bands and of course, their burgers! 
But what made our drunk little group have the time of our lives on a Monday St. patty's night? Well, boardgames of course...Cards of Humanity and Jenga were our choice of games but they have stacks of different boards on the corner that can be borrowed with just your id! 

The drinks were light, my friend had ordered a Pot of gold from their St. Patty's special menu and literally got a splash of Jameson ...or maybe a drop? 
I had the Irish coffee with Jameson - but it was pretty much cold coffee in a coffee mug! 

If it weren't for the entertainment of the live bands inside and the funny ass game outdoors I would of left a lot earlier!

items.location:
St. Regis Resort Monarch Beach
1 Monarch Beach Resort
Dana Point CA 92629

place_details.adr_address: 1 Monarch Beach Resort N, Dana Point, CA 92629, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 1 Monarch Beach Resort N, Dana Point, CA 92629, United States
place_details.name: The St. Regis Monarch Beach

reviews.text: very Nice Resort! i have been there several Times and every time I have stayed here its always the same thing all the staff are wonderful and helpful. The rooms are very well appointed (although a tad dark for reading, but I understand that they're correcting that), the service is impeccable. Small wishes are granted  with a sense of graciousness that makes you feel very pampered, like you're the very best guest they've ever had(!)  No nickel and diming once you succumb to the $25 resort fee. Stunning grounds, fabulous pool, gorgeous stay-all-day beach and lots of good restaurants. because there's so much to explore and so many good dining options and A beautiful hotel with a fabulous beach club. We came back to our room one evening and there was a bottle of champagne chilling. I called the front desk to see if they could tell me who sent it, and apparently the hotel had sent it complimentary. Service was great and would stay at this Hotel again Not just beautiful; beyond it! Stellar yet far from stuffy, professional yet personable customer & guest service. Immaculate views and accommodations... Enjoy.

Beautifully location, very peaceful, but unfortunately this hotel suffers from the rip off tax, once they have you in, they feel it their duty to overcharge you. Adding 21% plus $5 to a $10 bagel when in room, plus charging you $15 for using the internet, despite paying $300+ per night. It's a shame these hotels feel the necessity to behave like crooks. My stay would of been a lot less pleasant without these charges added.
Love the resort. I hate that we had money stolen out of our room also.  Resort did nothing to compensate our grief even though we were regulars there for years

This was, perhaps, the best hotel I've ever stayed in. Compares favorably to Grand Wailea Beach Hotel, St. Regis in Hawaii, so it's not just the lovely location in Dana Point. The rooms are very well appointed (although a tad dark for reading, but I understand that they're correcting that), the service is impeccable. Small wishes are granted  with a sense of graciousness that makes you feel very pampered, like you're the very best guest they've ever had(!)  No nickel and diming once you succumb to the $25 resort fee. Stunning grounds, fabulous pool, gorgeous stay-all-day beach and lots of good restaurants. We actually never left the resort on our short-ish stay, which is rare for us, because there's so much to explore and so many good dining options. Enjoy.

Be careful staying at this resort.  While they say they provide butler service, it is really a scam for them to steal from you.  I left my wallet, jewelry and some clothes in my room.  When I reported that I inadvertently left the items, I was told there was no way I could have left the items as the maid would have brought them directly to the loss prevention office.  After repeated attempts to try and get updates on  my missing items with no success, I had to file a police report.  I was told later by the St. Regis loss prevention team that they work quite a bit with the Dana Point Police on incidents like mine.  Not a good feeling, as it seems they keep the staff that is stealing and do not turn them over to the police.  They later supposedly found the missing items minus $360 in cash, and sent the items to me but at the wrong address.  When I tried to verify that they sent it to the right address, they told me to contact FedEx vs telling me they sent it to the wrong address.  Pitiful customer service.

The next day my credit card had a cash advance of $570 withdrawn from it.  In addition, the thief tried to use my debit card.  Do not get lulled into thinking this is a nice resort where they screen their employees before hiring them.  It seems the loss prevention team is in cahoots with the service staff.    My safe was broken so there was no way to lock up my valuables in the room.  BE VERY CAREFUL at this resort.   And do not let the friendly atmosphere and staff think you are in a safe place.

place_details.vicinity: 1 Monarch Beach Resort North, Dana Point

place_details.adr_address: 102 Pine Ave, Long Beach, CA 90802, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 102 Pine Ave, Long Beach, CA 90802, United States
place_details.name: The Federal Bar Long Beach

reviews.text:
DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!!!! Unfortunately, I cannot express this enough. The ambience of this place is great and the the food is ok. 

However, my main issue with this place is the horrible customer service.  Somehow the staff managed to "misplace" my Visa Check card (the area I was sitting in required that you put a card down). It was missing, gone, vanished into thin air!!!! I was told that the rolodex that held all of the cards was dropped and they assured me that they would look for it at the end of the evening and that I would have a call from the General Manager the next morning. 

Unfortunately, this saga doesn't end there. Sadly, my banks lost/stolen line was closed, since it was about 10pm when I was told my card was lost, so I could not shut down my card. I awoke the next morning to see fraudulent charges for what I can only assume was someone's brunch in Manhattan Beach. 

I subsequently called my bank to shut off my card and then immediately following called The Federal Bar to inform them that my card did not just fall on to the ground of their restaurant, but that in fact it was in the hands of someone who was making charges in Manhattan Beach. Since I never received a call from their General Manager, I had to speak to the morning shift girl manager who was less than apologetic. "Sorry ma'am. All I really could do is comp your meal."  I stated that this whole situation made me question the credibility of their staff as it seemed odd to me that there were absolutely no charges made on my card for the rest of the night and not until the following morning. The manager then proceeded to start ARGUING with me and stated that she "knows the integrity of her staff!!" Right, the "integrity" of the staff that lost a customer's bank card!!!! Way to show such great "integrity" by making a bad situation with a customer, even worse. 

Do not go to this establishment. I would hate to see this happen to you.
I really enjoyed the drinks at the Federal Bar I got an old fashioned and my brother in law got a dark beer I love the atmosphere it  was really nice to be there the service was quick

Horrible experience! Walked in for a drink, upstairs bartender (great ppl) recommended I check out the downstairs area, walked into the men's restroom accidentally and was immediately told to leave, which was fine by me, why would I want to spend my money at a place with rude security. Almost dropped my purse in the way out when I was pushed by the security guard and fell on the floor with him continuing to push me. Would never recommend this place. Never even got a drink. Plenty of better places in the area. With professional security.
Great food, and the bottomless mimosas are a sure fire way to make the day go by quickly.

Very cool, speakeasy type vibe. The building itself is huge and beautiful I come in frequently for lunch and use the fast wifi :) Servers are very helpful and food is delish. My faves are the Blackened Brussels Sprout Salad and Chicken Philly sandwich. I enjoy the craft beer selection, as well.

items.location: Seven Grand, 2, 515 West 7th Street, Los Angeles, CA 90014, United States

place_details.adr_address: 2, 515 West 7th Street, Los Angeles, CA 90014, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 2, 515 West 7th Street, Los Angeles, CA 90014, United States
place_details.name: Seven Grand

reviews.text:
By far my favorite Tiki Bar in  Los Angeles!
The Review Seven Grandr provides you with a beautiful ocean view and with great, fun and yummy drinks and good food! The place is always clean, and the staff is quick and nice. Everytime I'm in the area I love to stop here for a nice and relaxing time.

Wish I could give zero stars. Bouncer was a prick. Asked me to remove my hat, per dress code. Fine, no objections from me. Said I'd stick it in my friends bag. Dude went on a power trip and said everyone just ends up putting their hats back on once inside. Told him I was only interested in drinking whiskey, not in wearing a hat. We took our business to Spring Street Bar instead. Way friendlier staff and zero hassle. The bouncer also refused the group of 3 in line ahead of us.

The ambiance and drinks are great. The part that makes me never want to go back is three-fold. The bartender made my Woodford Reserve old fashioned with Maker's Mark, which I saw and asked him to remake with the proper bottle. They overcharged two out of my three cocktails on my check, which they did adjust to the proper amount as listed on their cocktail menu. Then, I see a $20 overcharge on my bank statement than what I had written on my receipt. It could have just been 3 hiccups in a row - I do note that the bartenders quickly made up for the "mistakes". OR they do this regularly because if you're drinking at Seven Grand, you're probably not going to care about the money you spend here.

His is a great bar of your're a wiskey person. The mood is a nice lodge with great drinks. Depending on the volume of people sometimes it can be hard to get a drink in a timely manner. On certain days they do have live bands that are free which is a great addition to the vibe of this bar. They also have a patio area for smokers and a set of pool tables for players
I met my doctor at Maude's here on his way to explore the west. The young bartender chap, treated us to an array of concoctions that left us stumbling cheerfully.

items.location:
The Escondite
410 Boyd St
Los Angeles CA 90013

place_details.adr_address: 410 Boyd St, Los Angeles, CA 90013-1631, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 410 Boyd St, Los Angeles, CA 90013, United States
place_details.name: The Escondite

reviews.text: My mom and I , and dad , love my miller high life beer and getting our grilled cheese sandwiches,  which are out of this world .!! The fresh potato  french fries ....YUM !! Not only yhe food , but the atmosphere is great ! The girls that work/bartend there are the Best ! Always remembers you and are so welcoming.  Thank you for being the high point  of our 2-3 hour trips to L.A. . See ya next month .😚
A perfect escape from the toy district that I got myself trap into :-). I was there during day time; great service, delicious burgers and great choice of beer. Everything was excellent!
If you wana see douchebaggery fest, lots of leather wrist bands, wanabe Hollywood losers from other states...this is the place to be.
Best burgers in LA and a great beer selection!

Escondite is known for their live bands and of course, their burgers! 
But what made our drunk little group have the time of our lives on a Monday St. patty's night? Well, boardgames of course...Cards of Humanity and Jenga were our choice of games but they have stacks of different boards on the corner that can be borrowed with just your id! 

The drinks were light, my friend had ordered a Pot of gold from their St. Patty's special menu and literally got a splash of Jameson ...or maybe a drop? 
I had the Irish coffee with Jameson - but it was pretty much cold coffee in a coffee mug! 

If it weren't for the entertainment of the live bands inside and the funny ass game outdoors I would of left a lot earlier!

items.location:
St. Regis Resort Monarch Beach
1 Monarch Beach Resort
Dana Point CA 92629

place_details.adr_address: 1 Monarch Beach Resort N, Dana Point, CA 92629, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 1 Monarch Beach Resort N, Dana Point, CA 92629, United States
place_details.name: The St. Regis Monarch Beach

reviews.text: very Nice Resort! i have been there several Times and every time I have stayed here its always the same thing all the staff are wonderful and helpful. The rooms are very well appointed (although a tad dark for reading, but I understand that they're correcting that), the service is impeccable. Small wishes are granted  with a sense of graciousness that makes you feel very pampered, like you're the very best guest they've ever had(!)  No nickel and diming once you succumb to the $25 resort fee. Stunning grounds, fabulous pool, gorgeous stay-all-day beach and lots of good restaurants. because there's so much to explore and so many good dining options and A beautiful hotel with a fabulous beach club. We came back to our room one evening and there was a bottle of champagne chilling. I called the front desk to see if they could tell me who sent it, and apparently the hotel had sent it complimentary. Service was great and would stay at this Hotel again Not just beautiful; beyond it! Stellar yet far from stuffy, professional yet personable customer & guest service. Immaculate views and accommodations... Enjoy.

Beautifully location, very peaceful, but unfortunately this hotel suffers from the rip off tax, once they have you in, they feel it their duty to overcharge you. Adding 21% plus $5 to a $10 bagel when in room, plus charging you $15 for using the internet, despite paying $300+ per night. It's a shame these hotels feel the necessity to behave like crooks. My stay would of been a lot less pleasant without these charges added.
Love the resort. I hate that we had money stolen out of our room also.  Resort did nothing to compensate our grief even though we were regulars there for years

This was, perhaps, the best hotel I've ever stayed in. Compares favorably to Grand Wailea Beach Hotel, St. Regis in Hawaii, so it's not just the lovely location in Dana Point. The rooms are very well appointed (although a tad dark for reading, but I understand that they're correcting that), the service is impeccable. Small wishes are granted  with a sense of graciousness that makes you feel very pampered, like you're the very best guest they've ever had(!)  No nickel and diming once you succumb to the $25 resort fee. Stunning grounds, fabulous pool, gorgeous stay-all-day beach and lots of good restaurants. We actually never left the resort on our short-ish stay, which is rare for us, because there's so much to explore and so many good dining options. Enjoy.

Be careful staying at this resort.  While they say they provide butler service, it is really a scam for them to steal from you.  I left my wallet, jewelry and some clothes in my room.  When I reported that I inadvertently left the items, I was told there was no way I could have left the items as the maid would have brought them directly to the loss prevention office.  After repeated attempts to try and get updates on  my missing items with no success, I had to file a police report.  I was told later by the St. Regis loss prevention team that they work quite a bit with the Dana Point Police on incidents like mine.  Not a good feeling, as it seems they keep the staff that is stealing and do not turn them over to the police.  They later supposedly found the missing items minus $360 in cash, and sent the items to me but at the wrong address.  When I tried to verify that they sent it to the right address, they told me to contact FedEx vs telling me they sent it to the wrong address.  Pitiful customer service.

The next day my credit card had a cash advance of $570 withdrawn from it.  In addition, the thief tried to use my debit card.  Do not get lulled into thinking this is a nice resort where they screen their employees before hiring them.  It seems the loss prevention team is in cahoots with the service staff.    My safe was broken so there was no way to lock up my valuables in the room.  BE VERY CAREFUL at this resort.   And do not let the friendly atmosphere and staff think you are in a safe place.

items.location:
Chapter One: the modern local
227 N Broadway
Santa Ana CA 92701

place_details.adr_address: 227 N Broadway, Santa Ana, CA 92701, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 227 N Broadway, Santa Ana, CA 92701, United States
place_details.name: Chapter One: the modern local

reviews.text:
I came to Chapter One for drinks with a friend. The whiskey selection here is decent. So I ordered a few premium scotch whiskeys. Unfortunately a couple of my drinks were stale, as they did not match the typical flavor profile for the ordered whiskeys. This was likely do to low turnover on the bottles from which I ordered, for this I do not fault the establishment. They cannot control what people order and at what pace. 
I do however fault them for  their poor bar tending practices. When I got my check I noticed that my drinks were rang up at a 50% premium compared to my friend's, even though we had ordered the same drinks. The only difference was that he had ordered on the rocks where as I did not. I inquired and was told that neat drinks include an extra .5 oz of alcohol for which I was charged, and standard drinks include only 1 oz of alcohol. This practice makes the already exorbitant prices here even more outrageous.
On the note of exorbitant prices, I do understand that it is the establishments right to assign such prices as they see fit, but I usually only expect such prices of a higher end establishment, which this is not. Somewhere around my second drink they cleared part of the dining area to make room for a DJ, he started to play progressives house music which I thought was out of place until a mob of unruly patrons saw it fit to start dancing. I want sure if I was in a restaurant, a bar, a club, or possibly a dive. I do know it was unreasonably loud and stuffy. I obliviously left.

Happy Hour! Mon - Fri (3-7) $3 off tap. Can't beat $2 Old Chub.

Cam at the bar is awesome. So is Tim. They are people too! Be sure to get to knkw them. 

Crowd wise it can very.. Greatly!

What i do love? Late night available any might til 2am.

Food isn't nearly as delicious as it could be. Lots of interesting menu items, but they seem to be missing flavor.

Staff is friendly but aggravatingly slow. Have to wait for ever for service. you will sit for a long time before anyone arrives to take your order or brings you water. If you want a refill you will need to shout them down. 

Ambiance is beautiful. A very pleasant space, which makes the experience that much more disappointing because the food and service does not live up to your expectations after walking in.

Will I go back, probably if my friends invite me to join them there, but I wouldn't deliberately plan a return.

Chapter One is located on Broadway & 3rd Street in Downtown Santa Ana. This restaurant is a hot spot and seems like it's always packed, so book reservations. My first visit here was during dinner time and luckily they were offering a special GroupOn at the time, $28.75 for $50 worth of food & drink during dinner on Friday or Saturday. Good deal I must say!

The atmosphere is welcoming but can be a bit busy with people crowding the front of the restaurant and by the bar area. My friend and I were seated by the window at a high table. Service was exceptional that night. Since I wasn't familiar on the layout of the menu, the server explained the how the menu is constantly changing. 

Appetizers:
- Birds Nest & Scalloped Dish (forget the name sadly):
The Birds Nest was simple, light but refreshing. The flavors went well together.

Entrees:
- Beef Tip wrapped with Bacon with Mashed Potatoes: 
The dish was prepared perfectly. The pairing of the Chanson (Pinor) was paired nicely with the Beef Tips. It just brought out the flavors of the dish.

Dessert:
- Chocolate Banana Bread with Bacon and Lime & Coconut Sorbet:
My friend had the Chocolate Banana Bread. The dessert was a bit rich for my taste, but don't get me it's good just not for me. I prefer a dessert with zest and lighter. The sorbet was delicious. I didn't even want to share ha. 

Overall experience of the Chapter One was awesome. I have been back since my first visit for a quick drink with friends. Their Moscow Mule is amazing! Thank you to the owners for producing quality service, delicious food, and consistency.

The best thing about this place was the staff...A+! Very friendly, accommodating and the place has an overall nice vibe.  Unfortunately, we were not impressed with the food. We ordered about 5 different dishes and disappointingly they sounded better on the menu than they tasted in real life.  Would go back for drinks for sure but not going to be one of my dining destinations.

The Federal Bar
102 Pine Ave
Long Beach CA 90802

place_details.adr_address: 102 Pine Ave, Long Beach, CA 90802, United States
place_details.formatted_address: 102 Pine Ave, Long Beach, CA 90802, United States
place_details.name: The Federal Bar Long Beach

reviews.text:
DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!!!! Unfortunately, I cannot express this enough. The ambience of this place is great and the the food is ok. 

However, my main issue with this place is the horrible customer service.  Somehow the staff managed to "misplace" my Visa Check card (the area I was sitting in required that you put a card down). It was missing, gone, vanished into thin air!!!! I was told that the rolodex that held all of the cards was dropped and they assured me that they would look for it at the end of the evening and that I would have a call from the General Manager the next morning. 

Unfortunately, this saga doesn't end there. Sadly, my banks lost/stolen line was closed, since it was about 10pm when I was told my card was lost, so I could not shut down my card. I awoke the next morning to see fraudulent charges for what I can only assume was someone's brunch in Manhattan Beach. 

I subsequently called my bank to shut off my card and then immediately following called The Federal Bar to inform them that my card did not just fall on to the ground of their restaurant, but that in fact it was in the hands of someone who was making charges in Manhattan Beach. Since I never received a call from their General Manager, I had to speak to the morning shift girl manager who was less than apologetic. "Sorry ma'am. All I really could do is comp your meal."  I stated that this whole situation made me question the credibility of their staff as it seemed odd to me that there were absolutely no charges made on my card for the rest of the night and not until the following morning. The manager then proceeded to start ARGUING with me and stated that she "knows the integrity of her staff!!" Right, the "integrity" of the staff that lost a customer's bank card!!!! Way to show such great "integrity" by making a bad situation with a customer, even worse. 

Do not go to this establishment. I would hate to see this happen to you.
I really enjoyed the drinks at the Federal Bar I got an old fashioned and my brother in law got a dark beer I love the atmosphere it  was really nice to be there the service was quick

Horrible experience! Walked in for a drink, upstairs bartender (great ppl) recommended I check out the downstairs area, walked into the men's restroom accidentally and was immediately told to leave, which was fine by me, why would I want to spend my money at a place with rude security. Almost dropped my purse in the way out when I was pushed by the security guard and fell on the floor with him continuing to push me. Would never recommend this place. Never even got a drink. Plenty of better places in the area. With professional security.
Great food, and the bottomless mimosas are a sure fire way to make the day go by quickly.

Very cool, speakeasy type vibe. The building itself is huge and beautiful I come in frequently for lunch and use the fast wifi :) Servers are very helpful and food is delish. My faves are the Blackened Brussels Sprout Salad and Chicken Philly sandwich. I enjoy the craft beer selection, as well.

Best burgers in LA and a great beer selection!

Escondite is known for their live bands and of course, their burgers! 
But what made our drunk little group have the time of our lives on a Monday St. patty's night? Well, boardgames of course...Cards of Humanity and Jenga were our choice of games but they have stacks of different boards on the corner that can be borrowed with just your id! 

The drinks were light, my friend had ordered a Pot of gold from their St. Patty's special menu and literally got a splash of Jameson ...or maybe a drop? 
I had the Irish coffee with Jameson - but it was pretty much cold coffee in a coffee mug! 

If it weren't for the entertainment of the live bands inside and the funny ass game outdoors I would of left a lot earlier!

place_details.adr_address: Irvine, CA 92697, United States
place_details.formatted_address: Irvine, CA 92697, United States
place_details.name: University of California Irvine

reviews.text: I did my undergrad here and I can honestly say I had the best experience. I was a commuter but I was still able to get involved as much as possible and the professors and programs are great. Additionally, the social environment is great, all of the students and staff are very outgoing and social, making it very easy to make new friends and get along with everyone. I definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a great education and a a great college experience.

Can't understand why it is taking so long for the FDA to give their approval for the University Of California Irvine to get under way with the work they want to perform on people with RP or Retinitis Pigmentosa.  At 1st we were waiting on the funds now that the school has the funds we are waiting on the FDA, we have been waiting for over 2 years this is very frustrating.  We aren't even being kept up on with this might turn into a possibility.  We have been dreaming for many many years for an opportunity that might husband just might be able to see now that we've been given a chance for a dream to possibility come true we're still having to wait.  My husband has missed out on his entire life since this dreaded disease has taken his eyesight slowly for all of his life.  It was discovered around 5 years of age he was having difficulty with his eyesight but there was not even a name given to it yet.  He has lost out on doing all the things a child does, a teenager, a young adult, a young married adult, a middle aged adult & now and older gent.  None of this is fair in my eyes, I'm his wife of 41 years now & even though I have my eyes it's like being in a prison, because I've never been able to enjoy him & myselves life because of this horrible disease.  We are childless because of this disease neither one of us wanted to bring a blind child into the world, it's hard enough with a blind husband.  Please FDA at least I'd like to spend the later years with my seeing husband if this is possible.  We've heard in Europe this same research has been done on people with the same disease for a man who was almost totally blind now able to drive with 20-40 vision.  So FDA you see this is extremely hard to sit this out I'm in my 60's now and my husband in his 70's please let us enjoy each other in our old age we did the best we could until now.  Now there's is a chance and you know what they say when you get older you lose all your patience.   I give the school 5 stars for their effort they are making to do this research, I give the FDA no stars for dragging their feet.

My son Lewis Munshi  is currently studying Engineering. Building various forms of ecological racing cars. I recently made a visit from England UK. Really impressive University. Student residences and services on campus. Lewis fractured his fibia, early on in the year! With the support and sypathy

Why would anyone want to go to or support a school who would ban an American Flag?  Clearly this a gathering place for idiots.  Seriously leave our country!  As a mother of a soldier who fights for your freedom your are so incredibly offensive.  Cultural inclusiveness????  American History, read it!!  Melting pot would be a good starting point.  Then sit down with some soldiers, interview them, their families, see what they give up so that you can be so stupid.  Shame on you for thinking that pride in our great country is something to be ashamed of.  Sometimes you need to give up what you so easily take for granite to appreciate it.  Time for a field trip, take the first flight out of here.

i find it pretty amusing that recently people have been posting 1 star reviews because they claim UCI is anti american.

their logic: 6 students vote to ban display of flag (which btw the school vetoed)... therefore, the entire school is anti-american and un appreciative of troops. 

Yes, there will always be some students who think of themselves as radical and will do pretty dumb things, but there are those students at every school. however that in no way reflects the quality of education and overall environment of the school. 

I dont agree with the students who voted to take down the flag, but i very much disagree with the people who critisize the school as a whole because of six students. This grossly underminds the diverse student body at the school. 

UCI is an amazing school that, in its short years, has grown tremedously. I am proud to call myself an anteater, and a student of the school. There is alot more to the school then 6 people and you really shouldn't listen to those who say that there isn't, that the goodness of the school is determined by the few.. its not.
